document.title: Idaho Content Standards: English Language Arts/Literacy

9A11B1AA82BF465DA12BFA8BA7A8AAA3.description: Writing Components: Acquire Handwriting Skills for Print and Cursive Handwriting

F8FB523BEFF640708F1A5FB86F5FB018.description: Writing Components: Acquire Handwriting Skills for Cursive Handwriting

2CCDD5A1B32A4F439CF18AC533C46116.description: Write left to right, top to bottom, with appropriate spaces between words.

5555527F6C5D4D489EBF704DD1529868.description: Write upper and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

DD1777370DEB472FAAC36D516037D024.description: Writing Components: Acquire Handwriting Skills for Print Handwriting

EAE8E2B8E2C2413BBB688D1799383C65.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

E44004DD16924B41996DD53EE68B8BA4.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

8F348E6265C240949A900073F8995EE5.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

0B0F4BA4D2074925973B22A12313101A.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

B75716F42FED49EE9FECAF1D86B01A10.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

9BF10C9648414B0CA321B4ACC4638E7C.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

BE5A231012264B7AA8939739C93FDB3D.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

FE5DFBD02D704F42A360832BD8737F7C.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

34E57A7D6D8640F7AFA71AF81846856F.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

803BDA1F2DB041D183A441E86E15BF1B.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

B62C29717A1340BB9E15A0887E23A0B8.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and shortvowel sounds (phonemes).

DEA27112D03D4B0C851E395A69D930D1.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

1F6B9C5107AF49B2A8DFAD8A20AC3042.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

AAC56E6F73EC4FAFBCF66069D4787F8A.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

05EA0512C5374FA5B7BA7ED678622D25.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

47FBCBCB3C6B494D9E4E3AF8B6110D10.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

8D0C2FECEE0B4CE889B4575985918F94.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

3809B3D6C676491CBFF83012599E513B.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

311094ECEEFA4CF5AF0A403B5CDD053C.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

11DCE05220DA47B596E1DD03169DB39A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

E19215EB6A6F4E9C86AE2D3DC544E7C9.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

CBF36389B6BC43C28C8E8D276C5FEEAD.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

2631DAC71B294C4D857E2F8F496E4355.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

6F3FBC712268456580D0E9BC1BF16E16.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

DD678DA533C446328419FA668E37D72E.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

2F5B65470E344A7294789909850E11BF.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

5834CE503465458694D57C2520B132A1.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

00012D22EDAF4D6496C2FFDD70113CEB.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

9A926EAEDD9F4D968B3D3535E72F524D.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

DDDB54EB717D4E7BB6035381115F72A1.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

68675E420128474E961AA308ED24BE99.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

50F47EA394C04DB7931748EE1745D8D5.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

ED9C125BB72E4EF2A8369000DA87D465.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

2CC784CCED924B048D189CA5CEEF0E61.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

1DBAD611E55645A59F644A8A3A488AE5.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

0799965EC3994056B3ED9525973611DD.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is â€¦).

1569BAE14F11423BB8E3E3C604063FD6.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

B800CDAB0B6348D5985FE94340967F07.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

9702D4AA97A841E0AAFA590C971237E1.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

119F861545354F308FDAD978B62225DE.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

D713A976F4394CC0B70BA59A71A68407.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one lettersound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sound for each consonant.

6641BC504B1141CBA43EDE928FD8DBA8.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

9F474CC103724CD6B7C088F8D3884FC2.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

2F7901038E454360B674550B3196A4E7.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

A764F0E29E8049AFB3D10235A6C67E4A.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

2752DFA591144CE79EF137327F6CC94C.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

28473DFB696640F49CF481C0B257066E.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

E3676F677FAA43C8BD5C287B40BA3373.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

7F665E11B86C48CA976C4AD864027AC1.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

D4C83ABE85C442CCB7BE1486E2C28165.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

B809B0A885E44BAA844AA8DFD2B1EB2A.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

D33E77135B4648558AFCAAE9AF46F4F7.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

32A58BED4425496BAF47D0A4CCE07B44.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

7AE1EC88CFEE45AE87DE12AB091C9F72.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

D49CE02FBA38471D88B372898C817017.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

BE58D2F16779429A8F5FC6C544E45C10.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

C9F154AB89634D87B3A7FA967A6069AC.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

57805B1765F3476A98D771353C448B07.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

C252D6DC35D349E990BBEEF44C82996D.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

6DEDB4E74C9D4B009FCDF36003576496.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

A2C9531E90744C1EA9832B18749C8900.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

3FF0F781E56C463CA2A3D61D753E7D33.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

7962EDE209C542D4BFAB1C785EC76962.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

2C21AD43021B4B64AE930D6011704A94.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

2DA13034767A4495963FA6A631E21C8E.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

102BB6930EA64E8D808DB743BE734F16.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

C59A520FEB8A440782103921424D6C41.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

18CCC52F76614AF88F56202A0296F0C1.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

9E7CAE5CB4624B18AEE32C3A2B6F54C9.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks,poems).

C88340E627E543CDB4BD50146CE8C7CE.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

A1910899B72442A69C2670C381A09AB9.description: With prompting and support, identify characters,settings, and major events in a story.

CDA9D0B41C354A81A06D480252BB3F4F.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

135D95B9F59B4DA58384E240764FB373.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
